src:
Selain Kapolri, Presiden Jokowi Juga Lantik 9 Komisi Kejaksaan
01 Nov 2019, 10:29 by Marlinda Oktavia Erwanti
Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) resmi melantik 9 komisioner komisi kejaksaan. Pelantikan digelar usai Jokowi melantik Idham Azis sebagai Kapolri.
Pelantikan dilakukan di Istana Negara, Jalan Medan Merdeka Utara, Jakarta Pusat, Jumat (1/11/2019). Pelantikan 9 komisioner ini berdasarkan Keppres Nomor 62/M Tahun 2019 tentang Pemberhentian dan Pengangkatan Keanggotaan Komisi Kejaksaan RI.
"Bahwa saya akan setia kepada UUD Negara Republik Indonesia tahun 1945 serta akan menjalankan segala peraturan perundang-undangan dengan selurus-lurusnya demi darma bakti saya kepada bangsa dan negara. Bahwa saya dalam menjalankan tugas jabatan akan menjalankan tugas jabatan akan menjujung tinggi etika jabatan ekerja dengan sebaik-baiknya dan dengan penuh rasa tanggung jawab. bahwa saya akan menjujung tinggi tribrata," kata Jokowi saat membacakan sumpah jabatan yang diikuti para komisioner.
Prosesi pelantikan dilanjutkan dengan menandatangani berita acara pelantikan. Setelahnya, Jokowi menyalami para komisioner komisi kejaksaan.
Berikut nama-nama yang dilantik:
1. Barita LH Simanjuntak (Ketua merangkap anggota)
2. Babul Khoir (Wakil Ketua merangkap anggota)
3. Witono (anggota)
4. Sri Harijati (anggota)
5. Apong Herlina (anggota)
6. Resi Anna Napitupulu (anggota)
7. Muhammad Ibnu Mazjah (anggota)
8. Bambang Widarto (anggota)
9. Bhatara Ibnu Reza (anggota)
Tampak hadir Wakil Presiden Ma'ruf Amin dan para menteri-wakil menteri Kabinet Indonesia Maju seperti Menhan Prabowo Subianto-Menko Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto. Hadir juga Ketua DPR Puan Maharani dan para wakil ketuanya, Ketua MPR Bambang Soesatyo dan para wakil ketuanya hingga pimpinan KPK Agus Rahardjo, Ketua MK Anwar Usman, Ketua KPU Arief Budiman, Kepala BIN Budi Gunawan, Panglima TNI Marsekal Hadi Tjahjanto hingga Ketum NasDem Surya Paloh dan Ketum PDIP Megawati Soekarnoputri.

(mae/zap)
text:
In addition to the National Police Chief, President Jokowi Also Appointed 9 Prosecutors' Commissions
Nov 01 2019, 10:29 by Marlinda Oktavia Erwanti
Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) officially installed 9 commissioners of the prosecutors commission. The inauguration was held after Jokowi installed Idham Azis as National Police Chief.
The inauguration was held at the State Palace, Jalan Medan Merdeka Utara, Central Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019). The inauguration of the 9 commissioners is based on Presidential Decree Number 62 / M of 2019 concerning Termination and Appointment of Membership of the Republic of Indonesia Prosecutors Commission.
"That I will be loyal to the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia and will carry out all laws and regulations as straightforward as possible for the sake of my devotion to the nation and the state. That in carrying out my office duties I will carry out my office duties and will uphold the work ethics with as well as possible and with a full sense of responsibility, that I will lead tribrata high, "said Jokowi while reading the oath of office followed by the commissioners.
The inauguration procession was continued by signing the minutes of the inauguration. Afterwards, Jokowi greeted the commissioners of the prosecutors' commission.
The following names are inaugurated:
1. Barita LH Simanjuntak (Chair and member)
2. Babul Khoir (Deputy Chairperson and member)
3. Witono (member)
4. Sri Harijati (member)
5. Apong Herlina (member)
6. Receipt Anna Napitupulu (member)
7. Muhammad Ibnu Mazjah (member)
8. Bambang Widarto (member)
9. Bhatara Ibnu Reza (member)
Also present were Vice President Ma'ruf Amin and the ministers of the Advanced Indonesian Cabinet such as Defense Minister Prabowo Subianto-Coordinating Minister for the Economy Airlangga Hartarto. Also present were DPR Chairperson Puan Maharani and his vice-chairmen, MPR Chair Bambang Soesatyo and their vice chairmen to KPK leader Agus Rahardjo, MK Chief Anwar Usman, KPU Chair Arief Budiman, BIN Chief Budi Gunawan, TNI Commander Marshal Hadi Tjahjanto to Ketum NasDem Surya Paloh and PDIP Chairperson Megawati Sukarnoputri.

(mae / zap)
